metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25718 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way samba, as an Active Directory Domain Controller, is able to support an RODC (read-only domain controller). This would allow an RODC to print administrator tickets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
python3-samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Fixing this in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS would require substantial code backports. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. In environments where this is of concern, we recommend updating to a more recent Ubuntu version.

criterions.comment: samba package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu1').
